Legal_Issue: Whether the High Commission erred by using the applicant's last-known email address to request additional information
Evidence_Assessment: Email sent to last known address, no bounce-back or failure notification received
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate procedural unfairness or error
Credibility_Factor: Applicant failed to update contact information
Legal_Rule: Immigration officials are responsible for ensuring notices are properly sent; however, if communication is sent to a valid, unrevoked address without indication of failure, the risk rests with the applicant
Procedural_Issue: Alleged communication failure due to outdated email address
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to receive request for documents due to non-functioning email
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Found in favor of decision-maker; applicant responsible for maintaining contact details
Key_Evidence_Considered: Use of last known email address provided by representative
Applicant_Challenge: Lack of receipt of communication due to email issue
Defendant_Response: Communication was properly dispatched to valid address
Applicable_Process: Visa application and subsequent judicial review
Outcome_of_Review: No error found in administrative process
Governing_Rule: Duty of applicant to maintain current contact information
